isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - Hydraulic Anti-Lock Braking System (HABS) Installation Guide for OEMs and Body Builders (Includes Body Builder Installation Information) - Hydraulic ABS Bleeding Procedure for Unfilled (Dry) Modulator Assembly - EVACUATION AND FILL PROCEDURE

svcproc.title: EVACUATION AND FILL PROCEDURE
svcproc.para: Meritor WABCO recommends using the Evacuation and Fill Method for filling the dry modulator and brake system simultaneously. This method requires special equipment capable of vacuuming air from the entire brake system. If you do not have this special equipment, follow the "Manual Bleed Procedure with Electronic Control Equipment" below.
The evacuation and fill procedure is as follows:

step1.para: During the evacuation and fill cycle the following conditions apply:

step2.para: Outlet valves continually activated, cycled with power on for one second and power off for one second.
The total outlet valve pulse time must not exceed more than 150 seconds for 12-volt systems at temperatures of 68°F (20°C).

note.para: The valve pulse time may be different for various conditions.

step1.para: Evacuate system to 2.2 mmHg (0.0425 lbs per square inch absolute [psia]/3 mbar), measured at the furthest brake, for approximately 60 seconds.
Check for vacuum leakage for 10 seconds. If pressure rises above 6.65 mmHg (0.13 psia/9 mbar), then additional evacuation is required for approximately 10 seconds.
Brake fluid filling phase requires pressure to reach 14.5 to 43.5 psi (1 to 3 bar) measured at the brake. Filling time approximately 30 to 60 seconds.
